Stem: Fleshy and with spines up to 2 cm long. Green to greyish-green. Lumpy or corrugated twisty appearance. Can be cylindrical to club shaped, boxing glove shaped, or small and loosely attached.
FruitSeeds: Cone or egg-shaped, greyish green, seedless in Australia, and rarely seen.
Habitat: Grasslands, woodlands, urban areas, waterways, rangelands.
DistinguishingFeatures: Twisty stems distinguish from other Cacti (Cactaceae family).
